pullRequest.body:
add `MeasureTheory.integral_tsupport ` showing that an integral is equal to its restriction to the support of the integrated function.

motivation: this will be used in #12290 to reduce the integral to the support and enables an estimate by the measure of `tsupport` and the sup of the function.

</details>

```suggestion
    {M : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup M] [NormedSpace ℝ M] {F : X → M} {ν : Measure X} :
```

The `MeasurableSpace` can be inferred from the measure: using an implicit argument instead of a typeclass argument makes the lemmas usable in case the measure is defined on another sigma-algebra.

Also, let's put all those in a `variable` line (please remove them from the two lemmas).

```suggestion

variable {M : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup M] [NormedSpace ℝ M]
  {mX : MeasurableSpace X} {ν : Measure X} {F : X → M}

```

pullRequest.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/SetIntegral): add the restriction of an integral to the support

source.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral): the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem for `Real`-linear functionals
